meanings.definition: A mass of fine droplets of water in the air near the ground, limiting visibility.
meanings.sent1: The mists made it hard to see the road ahead.
meanings.sent2: The morning mists covered the fields in a soft blanket.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat disappeared into the mists, playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like mists, fleeting and elusive.
meanings.sent5: The mists danced gracefully over the lake, creating a mystical atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A thin layer of liquid on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The mists of dew glistened on the grass at dawn.
meanings.sent2: She wiped the mists off the mirror to see her reflection clearly.
meanings.sent3: The chef carefully spread the mists of oil on the pan for cooking.
meanings.sent4: The mists of rain left a shimmering sheen on the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The mists of sweat on his forehead showed his hard work in the sun.

meanings.definition: A cloud of tiny water droplets in the air.
meanings.sent1: The airplane flew through the mists, causing a slight turbulence.
meanings.sent2: The mists of humidity clung to her skin in the tropical heat.
meanings.sent3: The children ran through the mists of the sprinkler, laughing joyfully.
meanings.sent4: The mists of perfume enveloped her in a sweet fragrance.
meanings.sent5: The mists of pollen in the garden made her sneeze uncontrollably.
